title: Motion Health Algorithm Scientist
summary: The Applied Sensing & Health team has built innovative ways for users to improve their health, or watch for their lives, with their devices through motion. This team combines machine learning, signal processing, innovative study design and expertise in biomechanics and biomedical sciences to deliver important features like Fall Detection, Walking Steadiness, and the Apple Heart and Movement Study.
description: In this position, you will be working on motion health technologies. Roles and responsibilities include: - Collecting and analyzing data for prototype feature development in specialized mobility labs - Designing, implementing and maintaining algorithms and APIs for iOS and watchOS on embedded systems - Optimizing implementations for power, memory and performance - Close coordination with multidisciplinary teams across the company - Working closely with scientists, engineers, QE, and project managers throughout the software lifecycle in successfully delivering best-in-class secure and scalable systems Most importantly, you will help ship interactive features that impact millions of users on a daily basis. You take responsibility; you demonstrate creativity, initiative, and the ability to work to deadlines. You feel a personal stake in the product you ship. You thrive in uncertainty and strive to bring order to it. You keep your eye on the ball; you build strong relationships; and you are constantly looking to improve yourself and your team. We promote innovation and new technology to further improve our creative output. We are seeking a tenacious and passionate person to join this amazing team. If you feel this is you, we'd love to hear from you.
key_qualifications: Background in Machine Learning/Statistical Modeling, Computer Vision. Experienced and intuitive understanding of musculoskeletal biomechanics, engineering mechanics, inertial sensing. Enthusiasm for health tracking technology. Strong working knowledge of Python, MATLAB, OpenSim or equivalent.
preferred_qualifications: Familiarity with musculoskeletal modeling, 3D motion capture, instrumented force/pressure measurements, electromyography (EMG) a plus. Experience with C++ a plus.
education_experience: PhD or 5+ years research experience in Mechanical Engineering; Biomedical Engineering; Electrical Engineering / Computer Science or related field with relevant domain knowledge. Coursework or experience in some of the following: signal processing, biomechanics, machine learning, controls, dynamics, statistics, programming.
additional_requirements: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent interpersonal skills and communication (written and verbal). You are upbeat, adaptable, and results oriented with a positive attitude. Familiarity with biomechanics, physiological modeling a plus. Experience with C++ a plus.
